text: most global networks today include
resources located in a cloud and in many
on-premises locations you often need to
stitch together data from many different
locations just to monitor your entire
global network resulting in an
inconsistent management and monitoring
experience you need a simple solution to
build and manage all parts of your
global network now with AWS transit
gateway network manager you are able to
centrally manage and monitor your
network bringing your AWS regions and
on-premises locations together
connecting thousands of Amazon virtual
private clouds and on-premises networks
to a single gateway a single global view
of your network only takes register in
your AWS transit gateways and defining
your on-premises resources now you can
monitor and manage your global network
from a centralized operational dashboard
see your global network through
Geographic views and interactive
topology review usage metrics from
connections to your network events for
network topology changes routing updates
and connection status changes and with
our SD win partners transit gateway
network manager gives you connected
visibility into your on-premises devices
in the same centralized dashboard and
setting up AWS site-to-site VPN
connections from your branches just
takes a few clicks transit gateway
network manager one place to manage your
network from AWS and all of your remote
locations
learn more at aws.amazon.com slash
transit - gateway slash network -
manager
